SRC: According to the Law of Uppland, the hundreds of Uppland provided as many as four ships each (four ships, each with 24 crewmen and a steersman, each equals 100 men), those of Västmanland two ships and those of Roslagen one ship (the name indicate that this was seen as just one ship's crew but they were not part of a hundred and might have had the same rights/function of whole hundred only fewer people). SRC: Under section 50(1) of the Police Force Ordinance, a police officer can apprehend (i.e. arrest) a person if he reasonably suspects the person being arrested is guilty of an offence. SRC: After Antoine Arnauld's death in 1694 Quesnel was generally regarded as the leader of the Jansenist party; and his Réflexions morales sur le Nouveau Testament played almost as large a part in its literature as Jansen's Augustinus itself. SRC: His son Naweej expanded the empire further and is known as the first Lunda emperor, with the title Mwata Yamvo (mwaant yaav, mwant yav), the Lord of Vipers. [[SEP]] The mwata yamvo assigned a cilool or kilolo (royal adviser) and tax collector to each state conquered.

WRONG-REF: La mwata yamvo assegnava un cilool o kilolo (consigliere reale) e un esattore delle tasse a ciascuno stato conquistato.

SRC: At the conclusion of the season, Bellof contested the Formula Ford Festival at Brands Hatch, but was excluded from the meeting after finishing sixth in his quarter-final heat, for excessive contact. SRC: He was a very productive artist who seldom made use of mythological themes or human figures, and when he did, always accompanied them with animals or animal friezes. [[SEP]] Besides the Gorgon Painter the painters of the Komast Group (585–570 BC) should be mentioned.

SRC: The publication (1710) of engravings based on these drawings made Nattier famous, but he declined to proceed to the French Academy in Rome, though he had taken the first prize at the Paris Academy at the age of fifteen. [[SEP]] Nattier aspired to be a history painter.

SRC: Kieft had his second and last abroad experience in 1990, joining FC Girondins de Bordeaux from France and again underachieving, returning to PSV and playing three more seasons until his retirement, averaging more than 11 goals in his second spell with the latter. SRC: A. O. Preus II was the eighth president of the Lutheran Church–Missouri Synod (LCMS) and drew fame for his role in the church schism of the 1970s known as Seminex. [[SEP]] A. O. Preus was a politician who served as Minnesota's eighth state auditor and 20th governor.

WRONG-REF: A. O. Preus fu una politica che lavorò come ottava revisora statale del Minnesota e ventesima governatrice.

SRC: A physician had his clinic on the first floor and a joiner who possibly worked for the piano factory was based on the second floor. [[SEP]] The physician on the first floor was eventually succeeded by two lawyers.

WRONG-REF: La dottoressa del primo piano fu poi sostituita da due avvocati.

SRC: In 1949, Hamill attended the prestigious Regis High School in Manhattan, but he left school when he was 15 to work as an apprentice sheet metal worker in the Brooklyn Navy Yard; 59 years later, in June 2010, Regis awarded him an honorary diploma. SRC: During his final illness, he was given the honorary title of Canon of St. [[SEP]] Ellerton was best known as a hymnologist, editor, hymn-writer and translator.

WRONG-REF: Scrittrice prolifica, Lariosa scrisse 300 poesie, 140 storie, commedie e romanzi.

SRC: He was educated at Queen Elizabeth Grammar School, Wakefield before attending Hertford College, Oxford, where he obtained a BA in Geography. SRC: In October 1977, he emigrated to the United States and was offered a position at the Naval Underwater Systems Center. SRC: Professor Hirotaro Narabayashi and his colleagues were the first researchers to carry out stereotactic amygdalotomy for the treatment of abnormal aggression and hyperexcitability in a series of 60 patients with psychological disturbances. [[SEP]] The procedure was performed under a stereotactic frame devised by Professor Narabayashi and involved the administration 0.6-0.8ml mixture of oil-wax to destroy the lateral groups of the amygdala nucleus, localized via pneumoencephalography.
REF: La procedura è stata eseguita tramite una struttura stereotassica ideata dal professor Narabayashi e ha comportato la somministrazione di 0,6-0,8ml di una miscela olio-cera per distruggere i gruppi laterali del nucleo dell'amigdala, localizzati tramite pneumoencelografia.
WRONG-REF: La procedura è stata eseguita tramite una struttura stereotassica ideata dalla professoressa Narabayashi e ha comportato la somministrazione di 0,6-0,8ml di una miscela olio-cera per distruggere i gruppi laterali del nucleo dell'amigdala, localizzati tramite pneumoencelografia.

SRC: His early training was with the late mannerist painter Cavalier d'Arpino, and he worked under the classicizing Francesco Albani. [[SEP]] However, Mola is considered to have been better as a painter of small pictures, especially landscapes.

WRONG-REF: Comunque, Mola è considerata ancora migliore come pittrice di piccoli quadri, specialmente paesaggi.

SRC: He was later elected to the Berlin Academy in 1746 and a Fellow of the Royal Society in 1748. WRONG-REF: Quando alla fine degli anni '40 del Settecento fu organizzata la pubblicazione dell'Encyclopédie, d'Alembert fu assunta come co-editrice per le sezioni di matematica e scienze insieme a Diderot, ruolo ricoperto fin quando la pubblicazione cessò temporaneamente a causa di una serie di problemi nel 1757.

SRC: He lives in suburban Chicago, Illinois, with his wife, Susan, and their four sons. [[SEP]] A journalist, writer and film producer.

SRC: In the early stages of the film, Grandpa Hugo was to have been revealed as the murderous Dr. Satan, who at the time was simply referred to as the mad doctor. [[SEP]] The legend of the mad doctor was to be a ploy by the Firefly family to lure victims in, though this idea was later scrapped.

SRC: In spite of his short stature and slight build, President McLean was an athlete and hero to most of the student athletes at the school. [[SEP]] Professor McLean was generous in extending financial aid to students.

WRONG-REF: La professoressa McLean elargiva generosi aiuti economici ai suoi studenti.

SRC: The expression parasaito shinguru was first used by Professor Masahiro Yamada of Tokyo Gakugei University in his bestselling book The Age of Parasite Singles (パラサイトシングルの時代, parasaito shinguru no jidai), published in October 1999. SRC: Praxiteles and his school worked almost entirely in Parian marble. [[SEP]] Some of the statues of Praxiteles were coloured by the painter Nicias, and in the opinion of the sculptor they gained greatly by this treatment.

WRONG-REF: Alcune delle statue di Prassitele furono colorate dal pittore Nicia, trattamento che a detta della scultrice le migliorò di molto.

SRC: In Texas, a physician who voluntarily assisted in the delivery of an infant, and who proved that he had no expectation of remuneration, had no liability for the infant's injuries due to allegedly ordinary negligence; there was uncontroverted testimony that neither he nor any doctor in Travis County would have charged a fee to [the mother] or any other person under the circumstances of this case. REF: Fu significativo che il dottore non fosse un impiegato del dottore curante, in quanto era solo in visita in ospedale e aveva risposto ad una pagina di Dott. Stork, e non aveva chiesto o si aspettava di essere pagato.
